Interface INilReason

Namespace
NDSH.Geospatial.Gml.BasicTypes
Assembly
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.ISO19115.Ed2003.dll

The INilReason interface defines a content model that allows recording of an explanation for a null value or other exception.

public interface INilReason : ITypeMetadata

Fields

NilReasons

Gets a ReadOnlyDictionary<TKey, TValue> where each NilReasonEnumeration key maps to an explanatory string used by the NilReason property to describe missing or voided metadata values in XML files.

public static readonly ReadOnlyDictionary<NilReasonEnumeration, string> NilReasons

Field Value

ReadOnlyDictionary<NilReasonEnumeration, string>

Remarks

Implementations must provide all the string representations of the NilReasonEnumeration enumeration values.

Properties

NilReason

Gets/Sets an explanation for why a value is missing.

The NilReason is a string value of one of the following three options:

  1. The value is a low case string representation of one of the values of the NilReasonEnumeration, except the value Other
  2. The value is a combination of the low case string representation of the value Other followed by ":" and then by a string providing a brief explanation, where text is a string of two or more characters with no included spaces.
    Example:
    other:brief explanation goes here
    The entire string must be valid against the following regular expression:
    other:\w{2,}
  3. The value is a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). A particular community may choose to assign more detailed semantics to the standard values provided by the NilReasonEnumeration. Alternatively, the URI method enables a specific or more complete explanation for the absence of a value to be provided elsewhere and indicated by-reference in an instance document.

Example: 

<pre><code class="lang-csharp">NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason(NilReasonEnumeration.Missing);
NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason(NilReasonEnumeration.Other, "Example reason give here");
NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason("http://www.example.com/a-detailed-explanation-for-nilreason/";</code></pre>


string? NilReason { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Methods

GetNilReason(NilReasonEnumeration, string)

Generates a NilReason string based on a predefined enumeration value. The method can be used to set the string value of the NilReason property.

The procedure makes sure that rules for setting the string are observed and should be preferably used rather than setting the string value using the property's setter. The reason for having a public setter in the NilReason property is to allow for XML deserialization.

Example: 

<pre><code class="lang-csharp">NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason(NilReasonEnumeration.Missing);
NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason(NilReasonEnumeration.Other, "Example reason given here");</code></pre>


public static string GetNilReason(NilReasonEnumeration nilReasonEnum, string otherAdditionalReason = "Reason not in list")

Parameters

nilReasonEnum NilReasonEnumeration

The NilReasonEnumeration value.

otherAdditionalReason string

Allows a string value providing a brief reason to be appended after the Other. The argument's value will be used only if the enumerated value provided is NilReasonEnumeration; in all other cases the argument's value will be omitted.

Returns

string

A properly formatted string with the NilReason.

GetNilReason(string)

Generates a NilReason string based on a URI reference. The method can be used to set the string value of the NilReason property.

Example: 

<pre><code class="lang-csharp">NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason("http://www.example.com/a-detailed-explanation-for-nilreason/";</code></pre>


public static string GetNilReason(string uriString)

Parameters

uriString string

The string holding a URI describing in detail the reason for a null / void or exception.

Returns

string

A string with the Nil Reason.

Remarks

The URI method enables a specific or more complete explanation for the absence of a value to be provided elsewhere and indicated by-reference in an instance document.
